name: multinuclear
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
(of a cell) having more than one nucleus (= the part of a cell that controls its growth): It sometimes assumes the form of a multinuclear giant cell with two to three nuclei. Synonyms
multinucleate
multinucleated
More examplesFewer examplesThis results in the formation of a single hypertrophied multinuclear cell complex.The occurrence of multinuclear follicles has also been reported in other mammals.The inner cyst wall is located intracellularly within a large multinuclear host cell.Some species are observed to form swarms that fuse to form a single multinuclear cell during feeding.
